full_summary:
# Government Tender Announcement

## Title:
Advance Notice for the Provision of Commissioning Services in Ontario
## Reference Number:
MX-42892873549
## Publication Date:
2023-10-12
## Closing Date:
2023-12-08T14:00:00

### Purpose of the Advance Notice
This is an advance notice of a potential procurement opportunity to establish a source list of consultants for the provision of commissioning services in Ontario. The notice does not constitute a formal bid solicitation and is intended to provide interested consultants with an opportunity to begin the sponsorship request process for obtaining the required security clearance(s).

### Description of the Project and Services
Defence Construction Canada (DCC) intends to establish a source list of consultants to provide commissioning services for the Department of National Defence (DND) in Ontario. The objective is to select three (3) firms to provide "as and when required" existing building and new building commissioning services. The estimated maximum value of the contract is $4,000,000.00 and the contract term is up to five (5) years.

### Required Security Clearance(s)
Consultants must actively hold all required security clearance(s) at the time of closing. The anticipated required security clearance(s) are:

* Designated Organization Screening (DOS) granted or approved by the Contract Security Program (CSP), Public Works and Government Services Canada (PWGSC).

### Industrial Security Program (ISP) Sponsorship
DCC is providing consultants with early access to the security clearance application process through sponsorship under its ISP. Consultants interested in submitting a proposal must begin the security clearance application process by applying through DCC's ISP.

### Contact Information
* Mary Kennedy, Team Leader, Contract Services, Defence Construction Canada
* Phone: 705-491-2734
* Email: Mary.Kennedy@dcc-cdc.gc.ca
* Website: https://www.dcc-cdc.gc.ca/industry/security-requirements

### Disclaimer
DCC does not provide any assurances or guarantees that a sponsorship request package or a security clearance application will be successful or result in the granting of the requested security clearance(s) in a timely fashion. Consultants must assume all risks associated with the process. This advance notice does not constitute a formal bid solicitation and is not intended to bind DCC to any contract. You can find more information about the procurement opportunity and access relevant documents on Merx.com. Fees may apply. Please see the website for more information.  The Advance Procurement Notice
